page.title: 04Predatory & Water Bird Pop.
page.content: Birds - Predatory & Water Bird Populations. The magpie population is increasing greatly with heavy predation of fledglings and young birds. Little owls breed and tawny owls have returned. The barn owl moved its nest site, due to disturbance, rearing only l young, after 2 in l983 and 3 in l984. An adult female and juvenile buzzard have remained from l984 and kestrels are seen. At Broomy Pool 5 pairs of Tufted Duck bred last year but only l pair succeeded in competition with a pair of Canada Geese. Since farm effluent outwash into streams is forbidden watercress has grown in the Gamber. Increased fish population has brought the return of the heron after 4 years and kingfisher.
